programme.desc: The historians reveal how the railways transformed the British diet, rescuing a nation that was struggling to feed itself. Alex Langlands and Peter Ginn discover how the mass transportation of livestock gave birth to the traditional British roast, and Ruth Goodman is in Whitby, which became a thriving fishing town thanks to the North Yorkshire Moors Railway supplying its kippers. Plus, Hampshire's watercress line, which brought nutritional salad to the masses, and how the use of steam-powered engines revolutionised production at Britain's oldest brewery.

programme.desc: Tony Robinson heads to the south-west corner of Wales and one of Britain's finest coastal paths to find out why Pembrokeshire feels so English, even though it's more than 100 miles from the border. Tony's four-day walk traces the story of their conquest of the county, which he discovers was very different from the knockout victory at Hastings, involving a long, fiercely fought struggle.

Plus, why do some railway clocks have more than one minute hand?.

programme.desc: The construction of Kansai International Airport upon the largest man-made island in the world, in Osaka Bay, Japan. Pioneering innovators from the past such as Pierre Danel, who developed a system against the pounding sea, and 19th-century mechanic Richard Dudgeon made the project possible. The development of airports including Berlin's Tempelhof Airport and London's Croydon Airport are also explored to reveal how engineers attempted this feat of engineering..

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston travels to France to explore the possibility that Jesus married Mary Magdalene, and they had children. He meets respected scholars, authors and historians to consider the theory the son of God's bloodline lives on today.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.sub-title: Walking Through History: Nazi Occupation - Channel Islands
programme.desc: Tony Robinson heads to Guernsey and Jersey to tell the story of the islands' surrender to the Nazis during the Second World War. In Guernsey, he hears of the first bombing raid that heralded the German troops' arrival and sees the spot where the first-ever British commando landed in secret, only to see the planned revenge raid fail spectacularly. A ferry then takes him on to Jersey, where he finds almost all of its beaches have a bunker or a machine gun post left over from the conflict.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston travels to Sardinia to meet the scientists and archaeologists who have evidence that suggests giants once existed. Researchers have discovered abnormally large human skeletons in networks of elaborate caves, mines and tombs in Sardinia, China, the United States, northern India and South America. However, if the race did exist, it remains unclear as to why it has seemingly been eradicated from history.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Marine life at the poles, where winter temperatures frequently fall to a numbing -40C. Even when the sun reappears in the spring, its weak rays take a long time to melt the ice. David Attenborough describes how wildlife including seals, whales, polar bears and penguins overcome the elements to survive through prolonged cold spells.

programme.title: Train Truckers
programme.desc: Zak and Alex face a four-day mission to deliver a pair of classic steam locomotives for an Autumn Steam Gala at the Mid Hants Railway in Hampshire.

programme.title: Train Truckers
programme.desc: Documentary following the exploits of a family-run crew of heavy-haulage specialists as they transport the heaviest, longest and most precious locomotives around the world. Terry and Jason have been called in to move legendary steam locomotive Britannia. The 68-year-old vehicle has undergone a major restoration in Crewe and is scheduled to start running at the Severn Valley Railway.

programme.title: Steam Train Britain
programme.desc: Behind the scenes of three preserved steam railway lines - the South Devon Railway heritage line, the Ffestiniog and Welsh Highlands Railway and the Great Central Railway. Sports scientist Megan Smith has a dream of tending the fire of a steam locomotive on the Ffestiniog & Welsh Highland Railway, and she stokes the bolier of NG143 and sets off along the 25 miles from Caernarfon to Porthmadog.

programme.title: Full Steam Ahead
programme.desc: The historians explore the life of the South Devon branch line before the Beeching cuts of the 1960s. Peter Ginn joins a footplate crew and receives coal-shovelling tips from a veteran steam engine driver of 63 years' experience, and with Alex he learns about one of Scotland's most lucrative exports. Ruth Goodman finds out about the dangers involved in working on the Victorian railways, and how those who lost limbs were catered for by a dedicated prosthetics workshop. She also discovers how the railways came to the rescue when a deadly disease wiped out almost the entire stock of London cattle.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: Experts analyse the work of engineers including Sir Nigel Gresley, who engineered the world's fastest steam train in 1938 and Eric Laithwaite, whose linear motor made frictionless travel a possibility. These innovators influenced the engineering of the Shanghai Maglev, the fastest passenger train in operation on Earth, which broke numerous engineering boundaries in its construction. Held in place by a series of electromagnets, it levitates on an air gap of 10mm and is able to reach a top speed of 431kms per hour.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.sub-title: Walking Through History: King John's Ruin - Peak District
programme.desc: As the 800th anniversary of the signing of Magna Carta in June 1215 approaches, Tony Robinson sets out to discover the real King John. His walk across the medieval monarch's stamping grounds of Sherwood Forest and the Peak District reveals a hapless man stumbling from crisis to crisis who, in the end, had no choice but to sign away some of his power. In the midst of what are now cultivated fields, Tony finds the scant remains of Laxton Castle, once the control centre where strict 'forest law' was administered and where taxes and fines flooded into the royal coffers. Later, in Sherwood, he explores how the myth of Robin Hood has helped to skew the public's image of King John.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston travels to Jerusalem in search of Solomon's Temple. When the Romans sacked the city in 70AD, the fabled Treasure of Solomons was believed to have been looted and taken back to Rome. However, it is possible it was hidden away by the High Priests. Archaeologists Dr Shimon Gibson and Kate Raphael have dedicated their lives working out what actually happened, and discuss whether it is possible that Solomonic and Roman treasures lie undiscovered under Jerusalem.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: An exploration of the world's most densely inhabited waters, where variations in temperature owing to the year-long cycle of the sun encourage a vast array of marine life, from seals and sharks in the winter, to lobster and salmon in the summer, dolphins in the autumn and the walking handfish in spring. Narrated by David Attenborough.

programme.title: Wonders of the Monsoon
programme.desc: Colin Salmon narrates a documentary exploring how the lives of humans and animals across a vast area of the planet are affected by the transforming power of the monsoon rains. The end of the dry season in northern Australia sees 300,000 flying foxes gathering to drink while running a gauntlet of freshwater crocodiles, while in Sumatra a female orang-utan guides her youngster to where she knows a fig tree fruits at this time of year. At the Delhi stock exchange, the price of rice escalates every day the rains fail to materialise and priests submerge themselves in water and beseech Varuna, god of water, to come.

programme.title: Wonders of the Monsoon
programme.desc: The effect of the rainy season on wildlife in Asia, with floods forcing animals to flee from Kaziranga National Park in north-east India in search of the safety of the hills. In Cambodia, the Mekong river swells so much that water is forced back up one of its tributaries to fill the vast Tonle Sap lake - one of the most productive freshwater fisheries on Earth. Fresh grass draws nomads and their vast herds of livestock back to their homelands, but they are stalked by hungry wolves and hyenas, which move in at night for the kill. Colin Salmon narrates.

programme.title: Wonders of the Monsoon
programme.desc: The other side of the monsoon, as the winds bring dry air and drought. Budgerigars swarm in the Australian desert, gathering at a precious waterhole, and although birds of prey try to ambush them, they are mesmerised by the array of bright colours on show. On the island of Borneo, a bearded pig hunts for seafood on the beach, while in the Rajasthan desert, nomads haggle over the price of camels, which can provide vital transport during this lean season. The mugger crocodiles of Sri Lanka stalk the animals taking a much-needed drink and a young leopard learning to hunt discovers there is no such thing as an easy meal. Colin Salmon narrates.

The programme also features rare performances from George Benson, Leo Kottke, Link Wray and Tom Petty.

programme.desc: Documentary offering an insight into some of the events in the Bible, beginning with the story of the Ten Plagues. In the Old Testament, the Book of Exodus describes the epic battle between the prophet Moses and Pharaoh. Experts offer various various explanations for the 10 plagues of Moses and the mass exodus of the Hebrew slaves out of Egypt, a story that is a cornerstone of the Jewish, Christian, and Muslim faiths.

programme.title: Secrets of the Bible

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Acclaimed chronicle of the Second World War, beginning with an account of Hitler's ascent to power at a time when the Germans were stricken by humiliating military defeat, runaway inflation and economic depression. The Nazi leader's promises of regained national pride and prosperity struck a chord with millions of ordinary citizens, and he was elected on a tidal wave of popular support. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The months following prime minister Neville Chamberlain's declaration of war against Germany, in which the only casualties on the home front were those who had to endure the blackouts. programme.title: Full Steam Ahead
programme.desc: The team discover how the combination of increased leisure time and affordable rail transport brought a new kind of freedom for working-class Victorians. Ruth Goodman travels along the south Devon coast from Paignton to Kingswear, where she helps prepare a paddle steamer for a journey up the River Dart, while at Swanage, Peter Ginn finds out what it was like to work on the excursion trains and the impact mass tourism had on the area.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: A look at the Airbus A380, which as the largest passenger plane ever built can carry more than 850 people non-stop nearly half-way around the world. With the largest wingspan of any commercial aircraft and four specially developed mighty turbo jet engines, the A380 weighs 560 tonnes and getting it off the ground would not have been possible without the work of past innovators such as George Cayley and Frank Whittle. Key developments in aerospace engineering - from Richard Whitcombe's energy-efficient wing-tip designs to Nasa engineers' cutting-edge control system, Fly by Wire - helped bring the A380 to fruition.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson hikes up from Lyme Regis on Dorset's Jurassic Coast to the Somerset Levels in the footsteps of a ragtag rebel army led by the young Duke of Monmouth, the illegitimate son of Charles II. He sailed in from Holland around Lyme's famous Cobb with a handful of soldiers, believing the people would support him in overthrowing the newly crowned James II, who was also Monmouth's uncle, but, more importantly, Roman Catholic. The year was 1685 and the country was riven by anti-Catholic feeling mixed up with revolutionary zeal. Monmouth marched through the fiercely independent towns of Devon, gathering support from artisans and farmworkers. Meeting up with Billy Bragg in Colyton, Tony learns about the kind of people prepared to risk their lives for the Monmouth Rebellion.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston talks to author Joy Hancox about the alchemical roots of London, the design of famous buildings such as The Globe theatre and the mysterious figure of English poet John Byrom. He also meets a modern day potion-maker.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Veteran naturalist David Attenborough explores the fragile marine ecosystem of the coral reef, where all creatures, including the corals themselves, have to fight for survival. From tiny beginnings, the reef grows and develops over hundreds of years, providing support for innumerable animals - yet one storm can threaten the entire community.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: A look at the Airbus A380, which as the largest passenger plane ever built can carry more than 850 people non-stop nearly half-way around the world. With the largest wingspan of any commercial aircraft and four specially developed mighty turbo jet engines, the A380 weighs 560 tonnes and getting it off the ground would not have been possible without the work of past innovators such as George Cayley and Frank Whittle. Key developments in aerospace engineering - from Richard Whitcombe's energy-efficient wing-tip designs to Nasa engineers' cutting-edge control system, Fly by Wire - helped bring the A380 to fruition.

programme.desc: The comedian makes five train journeys taking in the spectacular sights of Africa, travelling to unexpected places in deserts and forests, villages and cities, and finding out how the railways are used today. He begins in the north, on a line that links the trading cities of Morocco, Algeria and Tunisia. Stocking up for his trip at a souk in Marrakesh, he boards the train for a seven-hour ride to the ancient city of Fes, and eventually reaches the Sahara - and his final destination of Tozeur.

A DNA sample provides a link to a rebellious teenager, and the team wonders if the killer could be related to him. But a whole new can of worms is opened when investigators discover the lad's mother was raped - could the same person have killed Agnes? Gerry and Steve hope that interviewing her friends from a local chess club may shed new light on the matter, but it's a possible professional issue that could hold the key to unlocking the mystery. Denis Lawson and Dennis Waterman star.

Starring Mark McManus, Blythe Duff and James MacPherson, and featuring a guest appearance by Annette Crosbie.

programme.desc: Back in 1983, 16-year-old Amy Taskerland was murdered on the night of the school disco. More than 30 years later, the unearthing of a time capsule and the discovery of her voice on a mix tape inside prompts Miller and co to delve back into the case, starting by interviewing Amy's best friend Harriet and her former teacher Mr Hines. The recording features a strange mix of music and poetry, including words from a speech written in secret for the Queen for broadcast in the event of a nuclear war. But how did Amy get a copy of it, and was its secret nature the reason she was killed? Elsewhere, Miller enjoys her first romance since her divorce, while Gerry goes on his future son-in-law's stag night. Amy Nuttall (Emmerdale, Downton Abbey) and Jack Shepherd (Wycliffe) guest star.

Amelia Warner stars as the eponymous heroine, with Queer as Folk's Aidan Gillen as her evil aristocratic cousin, who wants her for himself at any cost. The cast also includes Richard Coyle, Martin Clunes, Barbara Flynn and Michael Kitchen.

programme.title: Lorna Doone
programme.desc: Lavish adaptation of RD Blackmore's novel of lovers, outlaws and warring families in 17th-century Exmoor. Amelia Warner stars as the eponymous heroine, with Queer as Folk's Aidan Gillen as her evil aristocratic cousin, who wants her for himself at any cost. The cast also includes Richard Coyle, Martin Clunes, Barbara Flynn and Michael Kitchen.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Sister Julienne receives an SOS from Holloway Prison, whose usual maternity workers have been struck down by illness, and when she and Trixie step in to help, the nun puts her reputation on the line to prevent a heavily pregnant convict having her unborn baby taken away by social services. Shelagh faces heartache when a routine pregnancy check reveals something far more serious, Alec has a confession for Jenny, and Fred takes the gang to the theatre to celebrate Chummy's birthday - only for the trip to end in disaster. Lacey Turner, best known as EastEnders' Stacey Branning, guest stars.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Jenny has an eventful few days, starting with a patient who as well as having herself to worry about, is also struggling to cope with her mother, an agoraphobic who hasn't been outside for at least 12 years. On top of that, Alec asks the midwife to accompany him to Brighton for the weekend, leaving her wondering if his intentions are strictly honourable. However, things soon take a tragic turn. Meanwhile, Shelagh joins the local choir to take her mind off her problems. Jessica Raine, Leo Staar and Laura Main star.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Jack examines a case previously undertaken by a deceased colleague, who was convinced that the alleged suicide of a journalist was a cover-up by the American government. Enlisting the help of a UFO-spotter, the team discovers the reporter witnessed a mysterious air crash near a US Air Force base, and the retired officers try to track down the original personnel to get some answers. Guest starring Mark Williams, Glynis Barber, Michael Brandon and Raquel Cassidy, with Amanda Redman.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: A woman is murdered and the forensic evidence takes the team to a cosmetic clinic where the victim had been receiving various treatments seemingly for free, but Nikki and Silva are frustrated by the CEO of Hamilton Ashe hospital when he blocks access to Karen's medical records. Meanwhile, when his daughter Rosie turns up at the Lyell as her mum is in hospital over a pregnancy complication, Thomas must play the doting father for a few weeks - a role that does not come naturally.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Trevor Eve and Sue Johnston star in the first of a two-part story. A woman who went missing from a care home in 1986 is found brutally murdered in a burnt-out car, and the team discovers she had recently abducted a teenage girl herself. As the investigation continues, both cases appear to be linked to an urban myth about a character known as the Bag Man - an eyeless villain who kidnaps children. With Eva Birthistle, Tara FitzGerald and Wil Johnson.

programme.title: Wallander
programme.desc: Two bodies are discovered on a life raft in Ystad harbour, the victims having been shot through the head and had their tongues burnt off with acid. The heavily tattooed corpses reveal links to the Russian mob and are instrumental in proving the men originated from Latvia, so Major Karlis Liepa, an officer with the country's police department, is sent to work with Wallander. But an anonymous phone call, a shooting and a break-in at the police HQ soon convince Wallander of a leak in the investigation - and he immediately suspects Liepa. Guest starring Soren Malling (The Killing), with Kenneth Branagh as the world-weary detective.

credits.actor: Kenneth Branagh as the world-weary detective

programme.title: Garden Hopping
programme.desc: Daphne Ledward visits the stunning Rowden Gardens on Dartmoor - one of the participants in the National Gardens Scheme.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Bramwell
programme.desc: Eleanor opens her new infirmary for the poor, but also agrees to help in her father's private practice. Period drama, starring Jemma Redgrave.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: The lads reach South Africa where they help complete the building of a medical centre, leading to romance for Jeremy, who falls for one of the nurses. Meanwhile, Andy Butcher lands himself in deep trouble after a kind-hearted gesture to help a destitute local family leads to accusations of ivory-poaching.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Yvonne is horrified to learn Beverley was assaulted by her own husband and promptly alerts CID, only for the case to take an unexpected twist when the culprit insists he acted in self-defence. Jim puts his marriage on the line by succumbing to his gambling addiction yet again, despite a stern lecture from June and threats from an angry loan shark. Jack returns to Sun Hill, determined to reassert his status as top cop, but his colleagues doubt whether he has fully recovered from his heart attack.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Donna urges Jess to stop pining for Zubin and get on with her life - and new anaesthetist Sean might be just the tonic she needs. Connie and Will bury the hatchet, and Owen discovers Diane is still taking contraceptive pills despite claiming she wants a baby. As Tricia undergoes her first radiotherapy session, Chrissie finds a lump in her own breast and makes an urgent appointment to get it checked out. Samantha Beckinsale guest stars.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Jude and Matt face an awkward time at work after their one-night stand and Kate returns to the hospital following Trevor's death. Meanwhile, a single mother who is smuggling drugs in her stomach arrives for treatment after being dragged from the river bound and gagged. Lisa Coleman, Jason Merrells and Sorcha Cusack star.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Tough former Met officer PC Roger Valentine joins the team and immediately makes a good impression by cracking down on muggings in the Sun Hill area - but his old-fashioned attitude toward homosexuality threatens to ruffle a few feathers when he's partnered with Lance. Jim continues to struggle with his gambling addiction and chilling CCTV footage of Abi makes Samantha fear for her daughter's safety.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: On Mother's Day, Etta is concerned about Lloyd's friends, while Sharon worries about the decrease in takings at the pub.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Ignoring his family's advice, Lloyd goes looking for adventure.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: The group draw lots to decide who will get to have Christmas Day off duty, and Josie and Bayleaf spend the night together. Starring James Hazeldine and Katharine Rogers.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: The roguish antiques dealer gets involved in a con at a country house involving the sale of a fake painting in exchange for a parcel of diamonds. However, Lovejoy later realises he too has been set up over the deal. Richard Griffiths guest stars, with Ian McShane.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: A recently paroled convict takes his son to Jersey without telling the boy's mother or his parole officer. Detective drama, starring John Nettles.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Adrian, who has been writing his memoirs, makes a decision that will change his life. Joey has reached the end of his tether.

programme.title: Are You Being Served?
programme.desc: Old Mr Grace recognises a photo of Mr Humphries' mother and begins to suspect the head of menswear may be his son and heir. John Inman stars.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Jean is concerned for Lionel's success as the day of his book launch arrives and wonders if Alistair will be able to help out with a publicity stunt should sales start to flag. Romantic comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Yours Truly - If You're Not Careful
programme.desc: Billy and Alvin learn that Truly's ex-wife is trying to find him, and waste no time in gleefully tormenting their pal with the news of a strange woman's appearance in town. Long-running comedy, starring Peter Sallis and Frank Thornton.

programme.title: Inspector George Gently
programme.desc: The chief inspector comes up against Rattigan, an old adversary from his days in London, whose legal challenge to his prison sentence has been upheld on the grounds that Gently fabricated evidence against him. Donald McGhee, the detective's friend and former colleague in the Met, unexpectedly arrives in Durham to offer support, but his motives remain questionable. With Bacchus torn between loyalty and ambition, Gently knows that it's up to him to find a solution to his dilemma. Sixties-set detective drama, starring Martin Shaw and Lee Ingleby, with Kevin Whately, Diana Quick, Nigel Lindsay, Morgan Watkins and Ralph Brown.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Part one of two. Gerry is spooked by the discovery of UCOS's latest victim - a cop, whose body has lain untouched under a basement for 30 years. As accusations of police corruption and underhand dealings begin to surface, Gerry has to face up to some skeletons in his own closet and it's a race against time for the team to help before his murky past catches up with him. While babysitting his grandson, Gerry becomes convinced that only he holds the key to the investigation and goes Awol to uncover the truth. Starring Dennis Waterman and Denis Lawson.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: The detective and sidekick Jardine investigate when a prominent loan shark dies after being brutally attacked with an axe. Jardine starts a relationship with an actress who is playing Lizzie Borden in the studio that owns the apparent murder weapon as the duo come to believe it may be a revenge killing - and that there could be a link with Glasgow's Garden Festival. Celia Imrie guest stars, with Mark McManus and James Macpherson.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: Beatrice considers her future with Jack and leaves Evie dumbfounded by accepting Larry Cotter's proposal to join forces and venture into ready-to-wear.

programme.title: Garden Hopping
programme.desc: Daphne Ledward visits the Old Mill Herbary at Bodmin, Cornwall, where a wide range of herbs and medicinal plants are cultivated.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Bramwell
programme.desc: Eleanor and Nurse Carr carry out tuberculosis tests in the East End slums, while Robert's electro-therapy treatment causes problems. Period drama, starring Jemma Redgrave.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: The soldiers help to rescue hostages in the African state of Mokindi. Meanwhile, Sadie and Paul are reunited. Starring Robson Green and Duncan Bell.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Tough former Met officer PC Roger Valentine joins the team and immediately makes a good impression by cracking down on muggings in the Sun Hill area - but his old-fashioned attitude toward homosexuality threatens to ruffle a few feathers when he's partnered with Lance. Jim continues to struggle with his gambling addiction and chilling CCTV footage of Abi makes Samantha fear for her daughter's safety.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Rosie is injured while chasing a thief out of the hospital, and undergoes an emergency operation - which leads to a startling revelation. Tricia faces her first day of chemotherapy and receives a grovelling apology from Carlos, who reveals he left her because he couldn't cope with her illness. Lisa is given the job of clinical matron on a trial basis, and Owen chooses Donna's birthday party as the perfect moment to publicly accept Diane's marriage proposal.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: A cleric attacks the driver whose car hit his sister and niece while he was drunk at the wheel, and a six-year-old girl is injured running into a greenhouse. Jude tries to tell Matt she is pregnant, but changes her mind after learning he has been asked to run a bar in Crete.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Kerry Young's funeral casts a sombre shadow over Sun Hill as the team gather to pay their last respects to their colleague, but any hopes of a dignified send-off are dashed by an emotional outburst from Gabriel. Debt-ridden Jim fears an investigation into illegal goings-on at the greyhound track will expose his own complicity, while the close professional relationship between Jack and Debbie turns personal.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: When a builder's estimate makes Frank see red, he decides to attempt some DIY.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Pat is shocked when she finds out that Mandy has being lying to her.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Drama series following the lives of the heroic Blue Watch at Blackwall fire station..

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: Jane helps the roguish antiques dealer search for a valuable Yeats painting in Ireland, until a more important matter captures their attention. Ian McShane stars.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: A private meeting of European financiers attracts the attention of three criminals, who break into the venue to rob the delegates. Detective drama, guest starring Patrick Allen, with John Nettles and Terrence Alexander.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Leonora announces she is pregnant, Lilo Lil brings Nellie news of Freddie's whereabouts, and Grandad dreams about his funeral. Last-ever episode of Carla Lane's sitcom.

programme.title: Are You Being Served?
programme.desc: Miss Brahms becomes the store spokesperson when Grace Brothers tries out closed-circuit advertising. Comedy, with Wendy Richard, Mollie Sugden and John Inman.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Jean and Lionel at last fulfil their dream and take a romantic trip to Paris - but it seems they are not alone. Bob Larbey's comedy about late-blossoming love, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Clegg, Truly, Alvin and Billy encounter a stranger who is determined to travel by canal to Ilkley in an inflatable swan. However, when punctures disrupt the man's dream, Entwistle is on hand to ensure the voyage goes to plan. Tommy Cannon and Bobby Ball guest star.

programme.title: Inspector George Gently
programme.desc: It's 1969 and six months since the shootings in Durham Cathedral, and while Gently is almost back to full fitness, Bacchus has lost his confidence and tenders his resignation. Gently is determined to help his sergeant, so he gets him involved in one last case, the death in custody of a man arrested during a street protest - an investigation that leaves both detectives questioning what it means to be a police officer at a time when attitudes to the force are changing. Martin Shaw and Lee Ingleby star, with Lisa McGrillis, Steve Evets and Ruth Gemmell.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Part two of two. Danny takes Gerry on the run as they search for the proof they need to prove his innocence - despite Gerry remaining tight-lipped about his involvement with dodgy dealings in his old unit. The stakes are high as the Unsolved Crime and Open Case Squad goes after one of the biggest crime families in London, and it's those closest to Gerry who are dangerously put in the firing line. Starring Dennis Waterman, Nicholas Lyndhurst, Tamzin Outhwaite and Denis Lawson.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: The body of a woman is discovered in woodland and all evidence points to suicide, but Taggart's suspicions are shared by the victim's sister who thinks her brother-in-law is responsible. Detective drama, starring Mark McManus.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: Beatrice receives news that will change her life for ever, while Evie is introduced to impoverished painter Daniel Page.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: The birth of Tilly's baby brings excitement to the workshop, but Beatrice is still concerned about her own future. Evie accuses Daniel of betraying her trust.

programme.title: Culinary Genius
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay tests the contestants' knife skills, tasking them to core and slice apples, then gives them 10 minutes to debone pork loin to turn it into four pork steaks. The final task is to create the perfect pork dish and, once the challenges are over, the three best finalists press on for the coveted title and cash prize. Presented by Fern Britton.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Studio courtroom show in which criminal barrister Robert Rinder rules on real life cases.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Entertainment, current affairs and fashion news, as well as showbiz stories and celebrity gossip. Presented by Lorraine Kelly.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: A mix of celebrity chat, lifestyle features, advice and competitions.

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: Another helping of topical studio discussion from a female perspective, featuring celebrity interviews.

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Dickinson's Real Deal
programme.desc: David Dickinson and the team are in Leeds, where James Layte is captivated by a snapshot of a man's military past, and Helen Gardiner comes across a walking stick.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Warwick Davis hosts the quiz, in which a family of five answer questions about top 10 lists then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Will they have what it takes to head home with the 125,000 cash?.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as contestants Liz, Tariq, Sue and Tom pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Charity sees red, Matty worries about what Moira is up to, and Sarah feels conflicted.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Fiz gets caught breaking the rules, while Chesney and Gemma take the quads to a glamorous photo shoot. Elsewhere, Leanne learns of Tracy's secret fling, but it remains to be seen whether she tells Steve.

programme.title: Bradley Walsh & Son: Breaking Dad
programme.desc: The actor Bradley Walsh and his son Barney return for a second series as they embark on another road trip across America together, beginning their journey in Florida, the southernmost point of the country. From there, the pair head to the Palm Beach International Raceway, before getting up close and personal with sharks.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Fiz and Tyrone are questioned about the Christmas Day shootings. Meanwhile, Dev orders Chesney to make a choice, and Tracy's explanation shocks Leanne.

programme.title: White House Farm
programme.desc: Six-part drama based on the true story of the mass murder of a family in an Essex farmhouse in August 1985, providing a fresh insight into these tragic events. In the early hours of August 7th 1985, Nevill and June Bamber were shot and killed inside their farmhouse, along with their adoptive daughter, Sheila Caffell, and Sheila's six-year-old twin sons, Daniel and Nicholas Caffell. Police receive a call from the only surviving member of June and Nevill's immediate family, their adoptive son Jeremy. At first, it appears to be an open-and-shut case to investigating officer DCI Thomas 'Taff' Jones, but for DS Stan Jones, something does not feel right.

programme.title: Scotland Tonight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's headlines from a Scottish perspective, plus local news from Aberdeen, Edinburgh and Glasgow.

programme.title: Piers Morgan's Life Stories
programme.desc: Timothy West joins the host to look back on a five-decade career as one of Britain's best-loved actors. The former EastEnders star speaks candidly about his 52-year marriage to Fawlty Towers actress Prunella Scales, and the impact of her battle with dementia on their lives. He also reveals the trauma of his first wife's mental health problems, and how he finally made peace with his daughter after several years of estrangement. On a lighter note, Timothy also reflects on his role at the wedding of Prince Charles and Camilla Parker-Bowles, and the time he toured the set of Coronation Street - disguised as former Soviet president Mikhail Gorbachev.

programme.title: The Home Game
programme.desc: Homeowners compete to make the biggest profit from a major renovation, while interior design expert Linda Barker monitors their progress and appraises the end results. In the first edition, a Surrey kitchen diner sees some extravagant touches blow the budget, a father and daughter plan a high-cost low-maintenance garden makeover in Essex and a thrifty upcycler creates an amazing bedroom makeover in Kent.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and entertainment. Actress Kacey Ainsworth, who played Little Mo in EastEnders, talks about the new series of ITV's Grantchester and what is in store for her and Robson Green's character Geordie.

programme.desc: Entertainment, current affairs and fashion news, as well as showbiz stories and celebrity gossip. Presented by Lorraine Kelly.

programme.title: This Morning

programme.title: Loose Women

programme.desc: Despite many summer holidays on the islands, Julia doesn't know too much about the real Greece, so here explores the hidden side of the dazzling, sun-drenched Greek Islands. She begins in picturesque Crete, intending to step away from the tourist trail, by exploring the Dikti mountains and its striking plateau of windmills. She meets goat shepherd Giannis, who shows her how he makes cheese using traditional methods. Her journey ends on the stunning but poignant neighbouring island of Spinalonga - once an exiled leper colony.

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: When a student from a prestigious all-female college is found dead, Will and Geordie infiltrate the murky world of campus politics and university societies to find the killer. Navigating strange initiations, raucous parties - and with investigative journalist, Ellie Harding, hot on their heels - they need to use every advantage at their disposal to unravel the mystery. Cathy's ambitions for a life of her own start to test the delicate family balance, while fresh from a spell with Daniel in Marrakech, Leonard finds it hard to acclimatise to life back in Grantchester. Robson Green and Tom Brittney star.

programme.title: The National Television Awards Celebrate 25 Years
programme.desc: Julie Walters narrates a look back at the long-running awards show. Previous hosts Trevor McDonald and Dermot O'Leary share their memories of anchoring the event, while their successor, David Walliams, looks ahead to taking the reins for the 2020 show. Among the stars sharing their memories of past awards ceremonies are Graham Norton, Ant & Dec, Holly Willoughby, David Tennant, Simon Cowell, Paul O'Grady, Richard & Judy, Danny Dyer, Craig Revel Horwood, Motsi Mabuse, Brendan O'Carroll, Phillip Schofield, Julie Hesmondhalgh, Michael Barrymore, Eamonn Holmes and Davina McCall.

This year's celebrities - six of whom will perform tonight - are Ben Hanlin, Caprice, Joe Swash, Kevin Kilbane, Libby Clegg, Lisa George, Lucrezia Millarini, Maura Higgins, Perri Kiely and Trisha Goddard and - in the show's first same-sex partnership - Ian 'H' Watkins. Michael Barrymore was due to compete, but a broken wrist has ruled him out, and he is replaced by Radzi Chinyanganya.

programme.title: Ainsley's Caribbean Kitchen
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott takes a culinary tour of the Caribbean, visiting the islands that have inspired his cooking. His first stop is Jamaica, where his father grew up. He visits the island's famous Coronation Market and a Rastafarian farm-to-table restaurant, where he learns to make ackee-stuffed ravioli. He also takes a trip to the villa where Ian Fleming created James Bond.

programme.title: Living on the Veg
programme.desc: Vegetarian food ideas, presented by Henry Firth and Ian Theasby. First on the menu are Sunday roast, vegan cheese in a toasted sandwich, sticky toffee pudding and snack ideas using avocados. The hosts are joined by actress Sadie Frost, who tries their jalfrezi curry.

programme.title: Gino's Italian Escape
programme.desc: Gino D'Acampo's latest leg begins in the Italian fashion capital of Milan, where he visits an elegant cocktail bar who were the first to introduce the idea of the aperitivo in the city. Its train station is one of the busiest in Europe and it's from here he travels on to the town of Treviglio, the home of Bianchi bikes - the first mass-manufactured bicycle in the world. Gino gets a tour of the factory before test riding one of their latest electric bikes alongside a group of local cyclists. Moving on, he visits the medieval town of Bergamo, where he meets ice-cream maker Niccolo, and visits a co-operative restaurant.

programme.title: The Greek Islands with Julia Bradbury
programme.desc: Julia visits the picturesque island of Crete, intending to step away from the tourist trail and head deep into its heart to explore the Dikti mountains and its striking plateau of windmills. She meets goat shepherd Giannis, who shows her how he makes cheese using traditional methods. Back on the coast at Rethymno, Julia tries the delicacy baklava, meeting filo pastry expert Giorgos, and also meets master artisan Nico, who expertly makes stringed musical instrument the Cretan lyra. Her journey ends on the stunning but poignant neighbouring island of Spinalonga - once an exiled leper colony.

programme.title: The Voice UK
programme.desc: Emma Willis hosts the latest round of the blind auditions in the spinning-chair singing contest, in which celebrity 'coaches' seek out the nation's best vocal talent. programme.title: Minions (2015)
programme.desc: A race of strange, babbling yellow creatures has served the cause of evil throughout the history of the world. In the 1960s, three of these eternal henchmen get a job working for a criminal genius who is hatching a plot against the British crown - but while carrying out her orders, they uncover a threat to their whole species. Animated comedy, with the voices of Sandra Bullock, Pierre Coffin, Jon Hamm and Michael Keaton.

programme.title: Dancing on Ice
programme.desc: Phillip Schofield and Holly Willoughby host the celebrity skating challenge, joined by judges Christopher Dean, Jayne Torvill, Ashley Banjo and John Barrowman. Another six famous faces make their debut on the ice in the hope of avoiding the skate-off at the end of the show against last week's lowest-scoring performer. There is also a routine by the cast of new musical The Prince of Egypt. The full line-up of celebrities are Ben Hanlin, Caprice, Joe Swash, Ian 'H' Watkins, Kevin Kilbane, Libby Clegg, Lisa George, Lucrezia Millarini, Maura Higgins, Perri Kiely, Trisha Goddard and Radzi Chinyanganya.

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: DCI Vera Stanhope investigates the case of murdered entrepreneur Freddie Gill, whose body is found by bailiffs attempting to repossess his house. As she delves into the case, she soon comes to understand that Freddie's professional life is just as turbulent as his family life, and Vera must uncover whether the motive behind Freddie's death comes from the trouble at the heart of his family, a desperate financial crises, or his glances with organised crime. Starring Brenda Blethyn, Kenny Doughty and Jon Morrison.

programme.title: Bradley Walsh & Son: Breaking Dad
programme.desc: The actor Bradley Walsh and his son Barney return for a second series as they embark on another road trip across America together, beginning their journey in Florida, the southernmost point of the country. From there, the pair head to the Palm Beach International Raceway, before getting up close and personal with sharks.

programme.title: Heathrow: Britain's Busiest Airport
programme.desc: An American airline has one of its busiest days as hundreds of people fly to the USA for Thanksgiving, while Heathrow employee Sunita helps a woman who has lost her two-year old daughter. Ground staff use measures to disperse birds from the runway to prevent any collisions with aircraft, resident paramedic Izzy treats a pregnant passenger suffering from serious abdominal pain who is due to fly to Brazil that day and British Airways employees prepare for the inaugural flight of their new 185 million aircraft the Dreamliner.

programme.desc: Recently single teacher Laura Nielson is set up with Andrew Earlham, a widowed surgeon and the father of one of her students. The two enjoy a first date, but the next day rumours and accusations begin to circulate and the two find themselves entangled in a web of deceit and confusion. Thriller, starring Joanne Froggatt and Ioan Gruffudd, with Shelley Conn, Zoe Tapper and Warren Brown.

programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Paul, Stewart, Lucy and Julia pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Long-running soap following the ups and downs of village life amid the rolling scenery of the Yorkshire Dales.

programme.title: The Metro: A Rail Life Story
programme.desc: Documentary following workers on the Tyne and Wear Metro - the UK's largest metro system outside of London. In the first edition, staff in Sunderland prepare for the arrival of 50,000 Spice Girls fans ahead of the pop group's concert at the Stadium of Light. The pressure rises across the day as head of operations Wayne spots a potential fault with an overhead line, and there's an anxious call to the control room - a set of fans have lost their tickets for the concert of a lifetime. Narrated by Zoe Hakin.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Things take a gruesome turn when Ferabbees Circus comes to town, bringing with it a chain of sinister clown sightings, threatening notes and deathly dangerous circus acts. Barnaby has to face up to his fears in order to solve the case. Drama, starring Neil Dudgeon, Nick Hendrix, Lorraine Ashbourne and Annette Badland.

programme.title: Scotland Tonight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's headlines from a Scottish perspective, plus local news from Aberdeen, Edinburgh and Glasgow.

programme.title: White House Farm
programme.desc: Six-part drama based on the true story of the mass murder of a family in an Essex farmhouse in August 1985, providing a fresh insight into these tragic events. In the early hours of August 7th 1985, Nevill and June Bamber were shot and killed inside their farmhouse, along with their adoptive daughter, Sheila Caffell, and Sheila's six-year-old twin sons, Daniel and Nicholas Caffell. Police receive a call from the only surviving member of June and Nevill's immediate family, their adoptive son Jeremy. At first, it appears to be an open-and-shut case to investigating officer DCI Thomas 'Taff' Jones, but for DS Stan Jones, something does not feel right.

programme.title: Masterpiece with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Alan and co-presenter Rachel Houston-Holland invite more teams of enthusiasts to compete to identify the rarest and most valuable items in stately homes around the country, continuing at Hever Castle in Kent.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.
